channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli army prepares to stay on border peak of Mt Hermon for winter
item.description: Israel seized control of a buffer zone between the Golan Heights and Syria after the fall of Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: McDonald’s employee who called 911 in CEO’s shooting is eligible for a reward, but it will take time
No-one gets France's difficulty more than me, says Macron's new PM Bayrou
item.description: France's fourth prime minister this year says he fully understands the "Himalayan" task ahead.

item.title: Foreign students advised to make plans before Trump. And, 2024's final news quiz
item.description: Why universities are advising international students to return before Inauguration Day. And, the last NPR news quiz of the year.

item.title: Kennedy Center honoree Arturo Sandoval credits jazz with saving his life
item.description: Trumpeter Arturo Sandoval credits jazz for helping him to pursue his dreams in the U.S. after defecting from Cuba.

item.title: McKinsey & Company agrees to pay $650M for helping Purdue Pharma boost opioid sales
item.description: McKinsey & Company consulting firm has agreed to pay $650 million to settle a federal investigation into its work for opioids manufacturer Purdue Phar...

item.title: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi injured during trip abroad
item.description: A spokesperson said Pelosi was "admitted to the hospital for evaluation."

item.title: What Syria means for Hezbollah's efforts to rebuild Lebanon
item.description: With a ceasefire in place, Hezbollah wants to rebuild Lebanon. But its supply chains across Syria have been weakened by Israeli airstrikes, rebel figh...

item.title: Bonnie Raitt on iconic music career and Kennedy Center honors
item.description: Bonnie Raitt reflects on her 50-year career, including iconic hits like "I Can't Make You Love Me" to her recent Kennedy Center honor.

item.title: Jubilant Syrians crowd squares for victory rallies
item.description: Syrians heeded the rebels' call to celebrate victory over the Assad regime which collapsed on Sunday.

item.title: Will Luigi Mangione's tipster get the $60K reward? It's complicated
item.description: The FBI and NYPD offered up to $60,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the UnitedHealthcare shooting suspect. But cashing in o...

item.title: Russia launches huge attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure
item.description: The Kremlin says the strikes were in response to Kyiv using US-made missiles to attack its territory.

item.title: How to prevent drowning: a ground-breaking report that's startling yet hopeful
item.description: The World Health Organization gathered data from 139 countries for its first-ever report on how to prevent drowning.

item.title: Syria in maps: Who controls the country now Assad has gone?
item.description: A visual guide to the latest developments after Syrian rebels toppled President Bashar al-Assad 13 years after the start of the country's civil war.

item.title: Founder of Mothers Against Media Addiction calls for passage of Kids Online Safety Act
item.description: Julie Scelfo, founder of Mothers Against Media Addiction and a proponent of the Kids Online Safety Act, discusses the dangers of excessive screen time...

item.title: Nancy Pelosi hospitalized after injury on overseas trip
item.description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is in the hospital after sustaining an injury on an overseas trip in Luxembourg, her office said Friday.

item.title: Woman who falsely accused Duke lacrosse players of rape in 2006 publicly admits she lied
Woman who falsely accused Duke lacrosse players of rape admits to lying
item.description: The woman who in 2006 falsely accused three Duke University lacrosse players of rape admitted publicly that she made up the story.
